note.p: Burial: Sephardi Jewish cemetery, Hendon, Middlesex
Research Field: Chemistry, biology, science administration, natural history
Education: Royal College of Chemistry, London

Career: Worked in the private laboratory of John Stenhouse (FRS 1848); Lecturer, Royal College of Science (1872); assisted in Norman Lockyer with spectroscopy; in charge of British Eclipse Expedition to the Nicobar Islands (1875); Professor of Chemistry, Technical College, Finsbury (1885); studied entomology
Memberships: FRAS; FIC; FCS (Lond and Berl); MPS; M Geological Association; MAnthropological Inst; Entomological Society
Obituaries: Proc Roy Soc Series A 1916-1917 vol 93 pp xxix-xxxii, plate, signed by W A T, xxxii-xxxvii signed by E B P
References: A Cohen, 'Roland Trimen and the merope harem' in NR 2002 vol 56 pp 205-218
Notes: Citation 2 is a continuation on a separate piece of paper, numbered Cert XI 106a
